Text.content:
It is often relatively easy for web developers new to OpenCms to create a temple JSP and to define a content type with the help of the XML schema langauge. What is often more difficult is the integration of a content type into a website: "I have developed a content type. How can I configure it now in such a way that it can be displayed in my website and dragged onto a webpage by editors".

This chapter shows how to configure a website with a first content type from scratch with special remark on the Formatter configuration. Formatter configurations control the interplay between several technical parts of a website: the XSD content definition, its visual presentation with a formatter JSP, its usage in a specific template, and its integration into the editing environment. In order to understand a formatter configuration in the context of these four technical parts, the chapter proceeds in several steps:

  • create an example website

The steps explain how the different technical parts are linked with each other.
